benchmark_details.name: CHEER (Chinese Buzzword Dataset)
benchmark_details.overview: CHEER is the first dataset of Chinese internet buzzwords, each annotated with a definition and relevant user-generated content (UGC) examples. This dataset is used to evaluate the performance of various definition generation methods, including a novel method called RESS.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To investigate if large language models can generate accurate definitions for Chinese internet buzzwords based on user-generated content and to benchmark existing definition generation methods.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The overall performance of existing methods remains suboptimal, indicating room for improvement in handling the dynamic nature of internet buzzwords.

data.source: User-generated content collected from social media platforms, including Xiaohongshu and Weibo, as well as definitions sourced from online dictionary platforms specializing in trending buzzwords.
data.annotation: Buzzwords were annotated with definitions and user-generated content examples, with a quality control process involving manual reviews.

methodology.calculation: Metrics were calculated using automatic evaluations based on generated definitions and their comparisons to reference definitions, combined with human evaluations for semantic accuracy and completeness.
methodology.interpretation: Good performance is indicated by high scores in semantic accuracy and completeness. Specific thresholds for acceptable performance were established through a combination of automated and human evaluations.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline methods include various existing definition generation techniques such as Direct Prompt, Chain-of-Thought, and FOCUS, with RESS showing performance improvements in semantic accuracy and completeness over these baselines.
methodology.validation: The benchmark was validated using human evaluations and a contamination-free evaluation strategy to ensure reliability.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: The dataset contains examples sourced from diverse user-generated content across major Chinese social media platforms, facilitating an understanding of demographic use in language.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: The dataset is derived from anonymized, publicly available internet content, ensuring user privacy was maintained during data collection.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: No personally identifiable information was collected, adhering to ethical standards in data usage.
